===Etymology 1===
{{zh-forms|s=蓬莱|gloss=-}}
{{wikipedia|Penglai Island}}
{{wikipedia|Penglai, Shandong}}
{{unk.|lang=zh}}.

It bears striking resemblance to a Southeast Asian word for “sea”. Compare {{cog|my|ပင်လယ်||sea; ocean}}, {{cog|shn|ပၢင်ႇလၢႆႇ|tr=paaŋ2 laaj2||sea; ocean}}, {{cog|kac|panglai||sea}}, {{cog|ksw|ပီၣ်လဲၣ်||sea}}. It seems to be a borrowing, possibly from a [[Mon-Khmer]] language; compare {{cog|mkh-pro|*d(n)liʔ|*d[n]liʔ|sea}}, whence {{cog|mkh-okm|danle}}, {{m|mkh-okm|danley||large river; lake; sea}} > {{cog|km|ទន្លេ||river}}, {{cog|th|ทะเล||sea}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

Alternatively, it is possibly a transcription of an earlier [[Austro-Asiatic]] name; cf. {{zh-l|萊國|[[w:state of Lai|Lai]]}}, an ancient [[Dongyi]] tribe, where {{zh-l|萊}} has been argued to transcribe a native word for "[[mountain]]" or "[[wilderness]]".
